Thankfully we had help at hand and after some time the attender recovered & immediately left for his home. Please ensure that all your attenders undergo medical test & check their medical history . This could have been dangerous.

Excellent physiotherapy by Dr. Rubina Singh. Its not easy to make my mother (a Traumatic Brain Injury patient, & bed-ridden for 8 years) take interest in exercise. Dr. Rubina takes personal interest in my mother, makes great efforts in personalizing the exercise schedule & has successfully befriended her so that she's more open to exercising. As a result of her efforts, my mother has started sitting without support for more than an hour at a stretch - the 1st time in many years. She has also started standing (with support) for a few seconds. All our best wishes are with Dr. Rubina as she energetically goes about her treatments.
Early morning or late evening slots should be available for working people.

What really tested my mothers patience was her constant talk about Jesus. She appeared to be a born again Christian. My mother is not a very religious person and this constant talk about religion and God was too much for her. One day Praneeta came for work with high fever and my mom had to look after her through the night. In fact she had to sleep on the sofa in the drawing room as Praneeta did not want the fan. My mother is a very patient person and she told us all about her after trying for a couple of weeks. We terminated her and we did not take any replacement from protea as my mom felt she would rather do without anyone. She did not want another Praneeta. Your organization is a long distance away from professionalism. Please give importance to minor details which will otherwise spoil your image. My comments below are for your benefit.

1. Be transparent when you take the request from customers. i was told the report will be delivered within three hours but it took more than 24 hours. I was told that you have your own labs for clinical tests but it was wrong. I was told the hard copy will be delivered later but it never appeared.
2. It will be a good practice for your representative who came to collect blood samples to sanitize his hands before touching the patient and also it is a standard practice to wear sanitized disposable gloves while taking samples and handling the instruments.
3. We will appreciate if you can collect medical waste like used syringes, swabs etc for safe disposal at your end and to prevent any harm to domestic servants who handle the garbage.
4. It will infuse confidence in your clients if your person carried the necessary accessories in a proper medical carrier box instead of a dirty backpack stuffed haphazardly.
5. Customer ID was not mentioned correctly in the report sent by email causing some anxiety.
6. It took 3 hours to clarify whether the report sent to me was actually mine.
7.I never received the hard copy of the report which was supposed to be sent by courier service. 
8. I received couple of calls regarding the tests and timing which was actually not meant for me but for some other customer.

Mrs Meena Ganesh,

You are a role model for many people, especially women, including me. And it<U+0092>s painful that our first intro is this way, ie, through a serious grievance against Portea, and i am left with no choice but to inbox this mail. Here is my rather agonizing journey with portea. 
24th Oct- I called your toll free no to get attendant services for my dad. They took my details and said they will arrange a call back and services form next day (25th OcT).
25th Oct (morning)- No services, no call. I did call 3-4 times on 24th to get status, only to get lame answers and false hope that someone will be there. They gave me Bangalore coordinator<U+0092>s phone no- Dilesh. He picked just once, only to start blaming toll free sales team. Verbatim <U+0093>they over sell, dont know ground reality, how could they commit an attendant etc without checking with me<U+0094> Then he said will call back, and as always he didn't just like others. Clearly left with no option sand disillusioned with this behavior from Portea staff, i put my comments on Portea FB page. 
25th Oct  (afternoon)- Simon from operations team calls me. Apologies etc. Said will arrange someone. Thankfully he did call back as committed. 
25th Oct ( late afternoon/ early evening) - Enters Dilesh again - so called Bangalore coordinator and the attendant. Dilesh -- let me remind you is same guy whom i spoke previous day and he didn<U+0092>t seem to once think before whining in front of customer. Anyways he came with attendant, took the cheque in advance and said all is sorted and this attendant will come for 2 weeks ( duration i signed for)
25th Oct- afternoon/ evening- I get call from Simon, which my husband took. He requested that we re-consider my comments on facebook now that issue is resolved. Wonder is that how you maintain your social fa<e7>ade<U+0085> Anyways I put a positive feedback on page, thinking to err is human<U+0085> But guess my mistake again to have believed in your services.
26th Oct- 31st Oct- Attendant came on time, left on time.. No issues as such, and i can<U+0092>t thank my stars enough for it<U+0085>. 
1st Nov, 8:15am- There , when I thought all is well with Portea way too soon<U+0085> No one turned up again. I called attendant, he gave me sob story how Portea deosnt pay, his pass is due and they havent given him pass yet and he has to spend from him end. And hence he isnot coming.. WOW.. Quite a not work culture at Portea I must admit!
1st Nov- 8:25am-  I tried calling Dilish - no response from him again. Wonder what is co-ordinator for when he cant pick phone and resolve issue- ever !! 
1st Nov- 8:30am - After numerous futile calls, i called Simon again. He again apologized and said he will sort out. But let me ask you this, how does apologizing help in reducing patient<U+0092>s agony, who is bed ridden, help me in returning my time<U+0097>for 2nd time in row I had to miss my commitments, and ease out the loss of peace caused by your staff. You deal in services which are crucial, a patient is relaying on you. Have you ever thought how a lapse can have serious consequences. 
1st Nov- 8:45am <U+0096> Simon called back, assured me that services will be resumed in 2 hrs.. Means, again my Sunday plans went down the drain.

1st Nov- 10am- The attendant finally came. 
1st Nov- 7pm- Attendant again said  that he will not be able to come next day as no pass yet and he might need to go to get it made.
1st Nov- 7pm- 8pm- I make endless calls to Dilesh<U+0097>as expected- he didn<U+0092>t pick call no called back. I treid calling Simon <U+0096>his phone was switched off. I tried calling team leader- Tangeer. He picked my phone (obviously not aware of the issue at my end). Once I informed him, there he too disconnected and never returned the call or picked my call.
8pm- Dilesh calls attendant and asks him to come out of house and meet on street. On being informed through attendant that we are trying to reach him he doesn<U+0092>t pay any heed still. 
8:30pm <U+0096> I manage to speak with Basant. He hears my plight, says will check and call. And thankfully he does. Tells me that Dilesh will call back and sort. Now I seriously doubt that Dilesh is any capable of handling any issue, yet no choice, so I waited for him to call
9:10 pm- Dilesh calls. Gave some vague excuses on why he missed my 20 calls since morning and evening. According to him, services will be resumed in morning at 8am, but honesty at this time I have no faith in any of the commitments made by your staff. Since I have no choice, I now have to pray and wait for morning and keep hoping someone turns up, else the same story if endless futile calls, time wasted starts again.
I think, as a start up, all your attention and efforts are going towards expansion and market share, however I think you should also take a step back and see what mechanisms you have to gather feedback and identify gaps like these, To me it appears, you are too keen on expanding, you advertise big, but at ground level, your units work in cilos, staff doesn<U+0092>t care of what they speak. No one bother about customers after taking money, thanks to your policy of advance payment and people at bottom level are the ones who in spite of working don<U+0092>t even get their dues, thereby impacting their loyalty to company or customers. 
I really do hope that after this, Portea finally wakes up and really does something to at least meet the standards and commitments that they have charged the customers , and then take a step forward to keep their customers happy<U+0085> 
From extremely dissatisfied customer- Rachna

Hi,
We were initially quite happy with Portea's process for providing us nurse attendants within 24 hrs (started services on 23rd Jan) and also visiting us in the hospital with coordinator & attendants. And then the 2 nurse attendants Kavita and Pranita were also very good and capable, polite, helpful in the way they handled the patient (Mrs Basu, my mother). But after 3 days when the nurse attendant Kavita informed us about her leave plans for 3 days from 28th to 30th, the entire handling of providing substitute attendant and communicating with us about the same was a very bad experience. SInce Kavita had informed us of her plans in advance, on Monday 25th Jan itself I spoke to the coordinator and told him to let us know who would be the substitute nurse-attendant for those 3 days and ideally ask her to visit patient's residence 1 day prior to familiarise with the location. However till Wednesday 27th Jan when I still received no info on the substitute attendant, I kept calling the coordinator and sent him 2 SMSes to send me her profile details but got no response from him. Finally on 28th morning when even at 8:05am there was no substitute attendant at my mother's residence, I called up your 1800 number and lodged a complaint with your Call Centre. After that at 8:19am I got a Whatsapp msg from coordinator that one Ms SHobhana would be coming to our place; but even till 9:15am she had not reached. She called my father and told him that she was lost and hence delayed; so my father explained the route/location. Finally 2 attendants Shobhana and Anjana arrived at 9:30am; and after speaking to their boss, Ms Anjana stayed over as the attendant. I was shocked to learn from Anjana that she was informed only at 1am of 28th that she had to reach my Mom's place in the morning; hence she obviously saw the msg only in the morning after she woke up and hence got delayed. SO my disappointment with Portea is that even after informing you on Monday about 3 days leave by Kavita, why could you not make replacement arrangements well in advance? Especially why did you not communicate her profile and phone number atleast 1 day prior to me (I could have called her up and explained our location/route and hence avoided so much of anxiety on patient/relative's part? The coordinator gave me the excuse today morning that the Portea person responsible for providing the substitute had not informed him earlier and hence he could not return my calls or get back to me with profile details on 27th Jan!Now that is a very lame and ridiculous excuse which only proves that Portea's systems & logistics handling are really bad when even 2 staff members cannot coordinate with each other ! So overall quite disappointed with this lack of communication that Ive faced in the 1st week of my taking up Portea's services. I hope you will improve your process and that this will not be repeated again. I've mentioned all these facts to Mr Ranju of the Mumbai office and asked him to see that this doesn't get repeated after 2 days when the night attendant is planning to take leave.

I will like to suggest on the fee to be less from the second visit.. so that we can take maximum appointment till it is not cured.

6) When i cancelled the appointment this morning, Dr called me and told that she has discussed my issue with portea team and they will now charge only Rs 400 per session. Well, not happy with this attitude as it shows that it is all about money and how to retail the patients and not about care. This also proves that you took extra money from me during first session.
7) I have found a physiotherapy center nearby where they have all the equipment and the charges are very less. Only Rs 250 per session. Also the physiotherapist is quite experienced lady (8+ years) and i think she can take better care of my mother.

The very 1st day when we had asked for the assistant's services for 4 hours as a demo and thereafter for 8 hours (after confirming with one of the associates on phone), we were shocked to hear that the assistant would work only for 2 hours that day! However, we thought that's ok (we can adjust) and looked forward to Portea's services!

Also, all of Portea's rules/regulations weren't clearly explained to us viz. if an assistant would leave early then, for that time, Portea would compensate the parents. This rule was only explained to us and came in the picture after the 1st assistant had to be changed!!!! It seems that there are road-blocks at every junction from Portea's end which might require some introspection and deep analysis!!

We aren't being too critical here however, the points mentioned below are our observations.


Manjula is good in her work (adjustable with our food preparation style and never complains, gave us some tips for feeding the baby like modifying some food stuffs which were very helpful, ensures to remove evil eye without fail) and is loving as well however, she is adamant and doesn't budge. She would like to do things in her own way even if that means the baby is sleeping she would want to wash the clothes! Due to the noise, the baby might wake up and on explaining the above situation to her, she was adamant and almost rushed to wash the clothes against our opinion/request!!!

We also explained to her about our baby's feeding habits (might not take thick fluids as this fluid regime was just started) however, she was still adamant when explained by my mom-in-law and when the baby didn't take thick porridge, she prepared it less thick after which the baby gulped in quick time!!

On the very 1st day of her job she slept for an hour or so (we understand she travels from quite a far distance and might get tired as we all are humans so, not an issue). As a result, she couldn't boil the feeding bottles. Also, on one day she kicked the baby's soft toy (bunny rabbit) away from that place however, she apologized for this when we explained to her that our kid plays with that toy.

On one of the days, our kid fell from her lap while trying to undress/dress. Luckily the kiddo didn't get hurt and she also apologized. We also understand the fact that such a situation might occur with any of us!

We don't treat this people as maids rather they're like a family! Whatever we eat (including breakfast, morning and evening snacks, lunch, ice-creams) we ensure that they also eat the same; ensure that they eat first and then, we eat at the end after everyone has eaten; either my mom-in-law or myself are always around to give a helping hand so she doesn't have to do all the tasks alone; ensure that they also rest if the baby is resting and all the other tasks are completed, gave another set of dress as the baby might defecate/urinate and her dress shouldn't get spoilt.


She goes a bit overboard and resorts to personal questions like -

a) From how many years are we married,
b) How was our child born,
c) After how many years our child was born,
d) Our house maid comes at what time and our association with her is from how many years,
e) Tasks to be assigned to our maid (we have to decide or an outsider has to decide that!!!!!),
f) What time our friends are visiting our home,
g) Asking my mom-in-law's personal mobile no. to talk,
h) Wanted to play on my mom-in-law's Apple Ipad, etc.


Also, erroneously she failed to notice today that (perhaps due to oversight) the bedsheet (on which we keep the baby rather on the mattress directly) was wet and the water added in the baby's milk was boiling hot. Good that we noticed this or else the baby would have got burns on the tongue or even caught cold! What's the point of having an assistant if one needs to constantly observe minute things or keep an eye on when the assistant has spend approx. 2 weeks or so????????

Manjula isn't punctual as she reports after 9:00 am however, she writes the punch-in time as 8:55 am daily (is it possible to have the same punch-in time?????? We can understand that we might take the same bus/cab daily which we all do for our office work; however, daily in time of 8:55 am was consistently observed!! The bus driver deserves credit here as he is more professional and a perfectionist than your team!!!!!!!) in her log book which is good 10-15 mins less and this happens everyday as per our observation from 2 days! This came into limelight today as smartly she wasn't showing us the punch-in time till now by folding her log book!!! Also, she left at 6:55 pm on 8Mar'16 and didn't give/instruct my husband to sign against that day. She took my signature the next day for the previous day so, that one doesn't check the logout time for the previous day. Also, she didn't allow and refused me to sign against today's log saying that "you might be tired, so you rest and we can sign on Monday". The intention might be good however, due to previous experience regarding her timings, we're of the opinion that she might be thinking that we might forget easily about her punch-in and logout timings!!! A smart cookie, isn't it???????

She ensures that she would leave by 6:55 pm (as she would reach home late, which is fine and not a concern) however, what about the missing minutes (she said she would compensate everyday by extending 5 mins however, we are yet to observe that)??? Counting last Tuesday (8Mar'16) and today's (12Mar'16) less time of 30 mins (15 mins x 2), this might come as 90 mins in a week (average 15 mins x 6 days)! Who's going to compensate us for that? 

We had good expectations from Portea as we had availed physiotherapy services earlier. We aren't expecting services at the drop of a hat as we are not PM/CM/VVIP's; however, you're charging a bomb (which we're paying from our hard earned white money) for your services so, at least we expected some professionalism which isn't observed!! This kind of attitude and approach isn't positive and promising.

This is the 2nd instance wherein an assistant was changed due to long distance and problems with an earlier assistant. Why doesn't Team Portea isn't proactive, plan properly and ensure that such episodes shouldn't recur Why does one need to react and search for a solution only after the milk has spoilt/damage has been done??? If the assistant isn't available, please let us know and we would start searching for an alternative as the only difference between Portea and people from outside is that the former speaks English and seems to be professional however, the situation is reversed here!!!!!!

Also how many chopping and changes does one need to do for the right assistant? When would our baby adjust to your assistants (as each have their own unique style and our kid is just 7 months old) if they are changed like we change our handkerchiefs daily!!!!

We would like to get our money back as we definitely aren't satisfied with the services provided!!!

Hope to receive a positive response from your end or else we might have to go for a legal opinion against your team for mental harassment, unprofessionalism and negligence.

This isn't a threat or a warning but, do try to understand our situation from parent's point of view as well! Also, this isn't the 1st time some of the scenarios have been occurring!!!

As per my understanding and the practice elsewhere,  the  physiotherapist actually works on the patient manually and/or with machines like diathermy, traction, vibratory massager, TNS, hot/cold packs etc. as needed, coupled with exercises with/after the treatment. In actual practice, nothing of such happens in Portea's case. Physio comes, talks nicely about historical aspect, makes the patient do some exercises and that's about it. He/she does not even touch the patient, leave aside giving any treatment.
If only the exercise were the cure, why would  we go to a physio?
This is my opinion, not necessarily correct or binding.

Deepak is a very polite, pleasant and presentable young man. He was willing to learn, very obliging and followed instructions closely.

However, there are some general observations i would like to share about Portea's services.

1) When i approached Portea, i was given to understand that all the attendants are highly trained and experienced. Yet, i was surprised to learn that the training is provided to attendants on dummies, and therefore, attendants are often raw and inexperienced when it comes to handling real life patients and situations.

2) Portea does not seem to have imparted to trainees a standard hygiene protocol, such as using gloves while cleaning the private parts of patients after they have urinated or passed stools; washing hands; use of wet wipes; use of underpads etc. 

3) The attendants do not seem to have been trained to operate even the simplest of hospital beds. They have little understanding of  management of patients who are confined to their beds - including turning them efficiently and painlessly; correcting/adjusting their postures when they have slid down the bed, or when they need to be fed.

4) It is extremely difficult for anyone to sustain a 12 hour shift for extended durations. Portea must build into their system a mechanism for substitution such that it does not inconvenience the client. Therefore, instead of adhoc absenteeism, every attendant should be given a day off every week or once every 10 days. However, the substitute should be oriented by the regular attendant, and not the client, as happened in our case...the one day that Deepak was absent, i had to cancel all my prior engagements for that day as the substitute, Anand, was unfamiliar with my father's routine and i had to spend the entire day overseeing him.

5) It is my suggestion that before an attendant is placed, the Portea supervisor and attendant must make a home visit and study the patient's routine carefully and work out with the client the hourly requirements. Portea must understand all the grooming, medication, bed management and other issues and requirements and ensure that the attendant being assigned has the requisite experience, maturity and confidence to fulfil the patients/client's needs.  

6) Attendants must be given strict instructions to keep their use of the mobile phone to a minimum.  

I would like to conclude by saying that none of the above comments are a reflection on Deepak or his performance. They are instead pointers to some gaps and shortcomings in Portea's training process.

My assessment is that this organisation is running at the whims of Coordinators. there is no check on them to see if they are arranging N/ A keeping in view the need of consumer and the interest of company. I have been getting service from this company for more than one year and I have been pointing out to one problem and it remains the same, it arises when ever N/As Martha and Aarti go on leave or I go to Noida to my daughter's house although I am assured that there would not be any problem in sending N/A to Noida.
 Last time,I was assured from Madam Aishwarya that  there would be no problem in sending N/A to Noida  although Coord Deepak showed his inability to send N/A there. I conveyed my thanks and expressed my gratitude to her for offering the services at Noida and also conveyed to her that I had arranged one since coord  Deepak had not assured me of providing N/A at Noida. I expressed my surprise and shared it with her also then. My surprise was that Coord Deepak was not interested in Revenue of the company  but in his own convenience of arranging N/A at Noida. Professionalism demands that customer needs must be fulfilled even at his own cost but it was not attitude of the coord. I told him if he could arrange N/A at Noida or I may arrange for myself. He was happy to listen that I can arrange myself and he agreed to my suggestion where as her attitude was the opposite one that she came voluntarily to arrange for N/A at odd hours.
On 26th April, 2016 I informed Coord Deepak that Martha was going on leave on 29th and 30th April, 2016 and I would be going to Noida at my daughter<U+0092>s house.  I also suggested him that I would take N/A Seema ( He informed me that Seema would come on 29th & 30 th April on day duty when Martha would go on leave ) along with me when she would come to Janak puri at 8.00am and he may direct Aarti ( who is coming already at night duty) to reach Noida for night duty. But he did not agree to my suggestion and told me that he would arrange someone from Noida. I agreed to it although it remains problematic with new comer. On 28th April I again reminded him if he had arranged  someone from Noida. He assured me that I would get. I made him clear that I would not be able to carry on with Seema if she continued 29th morning , then 29th evening and then 30th morning as it is not possible for N/A to continue for such long hours without rest. If it is done I would be taxed and I would have to do much of the work since she is not so efficient and also not having rappo with patient. Since I am an old man it would not be possible for me to share work with her at night then in the day next day. He told me that he would send another one from Noida. But on 29th evening at 7.00pm he called me & informed that Seema would continue at night and then next morning. I talked to Seema about it and she expressed her inability but she could not refuse coord and it is why she accepted it. Since she was tired in day duty as patient condition is such that she gives less time for her rest. I told her to go home and I called Coord to arrange another one but he declined. He neither agreed to direct Aarti to reach Noida although she was not allotted  any work on that night nor he arranged another one. With the result I had to manage myself at night and there was no N/A on 29th evening. It is evident this organization runs on the whims of coordinator not on the principle of professionalism. On One side ,Aarti was given salary for no work on that day and on the other, organization had to lose revenue since no one was provided to me and I had to look after the patient at night. I wonder if there is any check on the whims of coordinator. Is anyone held responsible for the loss of organization and for the inconvenience of customer just to keep the ego of coordinator? In simple words Aarti could be deputed to Noida and she had no problem in coming since she had been there already but it was not acceptable to Coordinator.
Since Madam Aishwarya had allowed me on previous occasion on phone that I can approach her with my problem without hesitation I put forward my view points to her but I did not get any feedback. On 14th May,2016 I planned to go to Noida and I informed coordinator about it. I also requested that Aarti ( who is coming for night duty )may be directed to come to Noida. He told me that he would arrange from Noida as it would be very far off for Aarti. I agreed to get N/A ( new one ) from Noida. To my surprise N/A on that night came from much farther from Azadpur. She came from a distance much more than what Aarti ( who was coming on night duty earlier ) would have traveled and again she ( Aarti ) was not sent for another duty. Again loss to revenue since coordinator was not interested in sending Aarti to Noida as he had already refused and ego was working and not company, interest.
I have all praise for Martha Horro N/A. She is very sincere and devoted to her duty. She is very punctual and knows her job very well. She has a good rappo with the patient and understands her problems. Since patient has been on bed for more than one year and she gets irritated without any cause but Martha handles her nicely. I wish her success and may God bless her.

I would like to take this opportunity to thank Dr.Chetan, the physiotherapist for helping my mother to recover well after her knee replacement surgery. But then opted for Portea and Dr.Chetan has been a god send person for my mother and has helped her recover so well and walk in a much better way. We never expected such dramatic improvement just by physio therapy but certainly this has been a eye opener for us and my mother and father are grateful from bottom of their heart to Dr.Chetan,
He is very systematic, patient, observant, caring and sincere.

I am extremely sorry for submitting the feedback a bit late as we were also waiting for CPM sessions, He was the one who suggested such a treatment for my mother and we would like to thank him for suggesting us (just that it would have been nice to have the machine earlier when he was doing the physio therapy for my mother) as were not aware of this. this can cause lot of damage to her muscles, so please check the experience of the physiotherapist, whether he/she has any idea about the  disease. Otherwise you are causing more damage to the patient. I had lot of expectations from portea, but was disappointed.

Some time after the appointment was booked, I get a follow up call asking me what I wanted to do as they had a report of a patient with a broken toe. I responded by saying why are you asking me? I'm asking you to send a trained medical professional. Finally a nurse turned up one hour late and he too seemed unsure of what he had to do. When he finally bound the toe, It was looser than the existing binding and was redone by a local gp. Overall not a very confidence building experience

The attendant staff should be trained in much better way. They should make patient do things like routine work etc. Most of the attendants who came were behaving more like scared servant rather than attendant. Patient will be irritated as he is a patient. How attendant deals with him in polite manner and make him do things that patient might be ignoring due to illness is attendant job. Attendant are not servants who sit ideal in front of patient and do only what patient says. Attendant's should have the confidence and should be trained enough to help patient get back to his normal life. Attendant service required in our case is because father is going into depression due to illness. And he has stopped doing his routine work. We need an attendant who can help him n make him do all his routine work again. After opting your service with about 15change of attendants my father has stopped walking as he is a rt mca patient. Walking is a must for him. He has stopped coming out of his room. Don't know if any of your attendant is talented and trained enough to handle his anger at the same time help him bring back to his normal routine. Befire we opted for your service I and my husband used to make him do all activities. Hoping his condition does not detoriate and he gets back to his normal routine. Don't want a dominating attendant but a friendly attendant for him. We may need attendant service for long term may be more than a year. Request to help us get some concession and a good trained and talented staff.

I am a Consultant Urologist at Fortis Hospital, Kolkata. 

A few days ago, my 95 yr old father was admitted with a massive stroke. After a week in hospital, I decided to take him home. I approached the Portea Counter in our hospital, who promised me that they would provide 12 hourly Trained attendants at home to look after my unconscious father, at a fairly steep charge.

On taking my father home, I have been provided with two completely inexperienced girls who have had 15 days training. They do not know how to check oxygen saturation, perform suction and even clean out the mouth of the patient. None of them has any Basic Life Support Training. On trying to contact your local representative repeatedly, Mr Nibarun Saha, I got no response to my calls or SMS. He called me up about 6 hours later saying that because of Ramzan, he was unable to provide experienced staff. However, this was not mentioned to me earlier. Neither were the charges altered to suit the level of experience. And care does not stop be it Ramzan, Christmas or Diwali.

I have had a horrible experience dealing with your organisation. Not only am I not going to refer anyone else to Portea, I will go to consumer court to ensure you are unable to provide young totally inexperienced girls for home nursing care. I think you web site is full of inaccuracies. Please rest assured that I will pursue this on social media too, so that others like me are not duped by your company. 

Finally, I would suggest you get rid of Mr. Nibarun Saha in Kolkata immediately.

Sincerely,

Sandip Banerji(Dr)
Consultant Urologist
Fortis Hospital, Kolkata
